question: What do you look for in your next company (in terms of people, office)
answer: Probably good to say things related to their culture. Show that you're ambitious and looking for the same. Startup related answers: small team, learning opportunities, making big impact, watching a product grow from start to finish. Bigger companies: leadership opportunities.

question: How did you hear about this company, how did you hear about this position
What are the job factors you look for when you're looking to apply here
How does this company fit into your career goals
Tell me about a time where you revolutionize the way something is done (work/school)
What do you bring to the team or company
Whats the most complex problem you solved recently with a simple solution
What is a good tech stack
What are some good software methodologies
What makes a good software engineer
Rate and give your top three programming languages or technologies
Walk me through your debugging process
How are technical decisions made in your team
Explain concepts (for example what is an API) to a five year old kid
How did you get into coding
How would you debug something that keeps seg faulting
Explain what happens when you type in a url and click enter
How would sell your fave programming language
Is Python a library?
How do you keep up with the latest tech?
How is your dynamic with the team, what do you do in the team
How do you divide the work in the team
How do you make sure your teammates aren't working on the same feature
How do you make sure your code is production ready
General question about how to work through disagreements and conflicts
answer: In general, stay calm and respectful. Try to slowly win by examples, by explaining, showing, or demonstrating specific cases.

question: Pair programming, convincing senior developer with your ideas
answer: Similar to the how would you deal with conflicting ideas question. Specifically say if you're working on a project together with a senior colleague and he or she is adamant about his or her solution even though you know that yours have more merit? Calm, communicate, and compromise. Sacrifice a little but stand your ground. Slowly win their trust by showing that you're reliable and dependable.

question: Give specific example about disagreements where you have very strong opinions about
What would your old boss say about you, how would they rate you
How would you deal with missing deadlines
Tell me about a time where you miss a deadline and the resolution
How do you deal with getting stuck or hitting a wall
What do you do when there is a downtime in between development cycles
How do you request more time for a project
Tell me about a time when something went wrong and how its handled
What did you dislike about your last manager
What other non technical interest do you have
Walk me through your most interesting side project
What did you build with your best language
What interests you, what do you do for fun
What motivates you to go to work everyday
What makes you happy
What are your greatest strengths, greatest weakness
What do you do at work, how is your work?
Under 1 minute tell me about yourself
What are your next steps, goals
Have you mentored before? Tell me about your mentoring experience
What does getting it right the first time mean to you
Ask the interviewer anything: questions about the company, product, engineering culture
When can you start work
What is your expected salary
What is your current salary
answer: Was asked this question once. Not giving a current salary is probably a good answer, adding 3 - 5% of current salary is also a good way to not disclose your real salary. What the recruiter want at the end of the day is just data.

question: What is your highest degree
Are you eligible to work in {country}?
answer: This question is often asked as a simple yes or no. For Canadians, I read a 'lifehack' that suggest answering yes to this because its easy to get a TN visa. I would not recommend this and actually answer no.

question: Are you currently interviewing with other places
Which companies are you interviewing at? What stages?
